availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Marshall Harbeson (Fleming County, Kentucky, court clerk)

body.p: Fleming County, Kentucky, court clerk. Fleming County, Kentucky native. Son of Benjamin Harbeson and Mary Harbeson. Married to Frances A. Metcalfe Harbeson in Fleming County, Kentucky, on August 28, 1856. Father of Mary L. Harbeson and Benjamin Harbeson. Clerk in the Fleming Circuit Court in 1860. Clerk in Fleming County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 1, p. 797.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, Augusta, p. 266A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994034, Fleming County Marriages.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Fleming County, KY, September 1863, p. 164.
"Mr. John M. Harbeson," The Evening Bulletin (Maysville, KY), September 2, 1901, p. 3.
"John M. Harbeson (1834-1901)," Find A Grave, Memorial 113731228, accessed March 31, 2020, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/113731228.
KYR-0001-004-0312.
